meanings.definition: Long, full sideburns or muttonchop whiskers worn by men.
meanings.sent1: He admired his uncle's dundrearies, which framed his face handsomely.
meanings.sent2: In the old photograph, the gentleman sported impressive dundrearies.
meanings.sent3: The dundrearies on the man made him look like a wise wizard.
meanings.sent4: His dundrearies were like two furry curtains on the sides of his face.
meanings.sent5: The dundrearies were so bushy, they almost hid his ears completely.

meanings.definition: A style of facial hair popular in the 19th century.
meanings.sent1: During the historical reenactment, many participants wore dundrearies.
meanings.sent2: In the museum exhibit, there were displays showcasing various dundrearies.
meanings.sent3: The actor's dundrearies in the play added an authentic touch to his character.
meanings.sent4: The dundrearies of the past were a symbol of masculinity and fashion.
meanings.sent5: She found an old painting of her great-grandfather with elaborate dundrearies.

meanings.definition: Excessive facial hair that extends down the sides of the face.
meanings.sent1: His unkempt dundrearies gave him a wild appearance.
meanings.sent2: The man's dundrearies were so long, they almost reached his chest.
meanings.sent3: The dundrearies on the cat costume made the feline look hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The dundrearies of the giant in the story were as long as tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The dundrearies of the eccentric artist were a topic of conversation wherever he went.
